label: burns
adult_instructions: Cool the burn with running water for 10 minutes. Cover with cling film or a clean, non-stick dressing. Do not apply creams, ice, or butter. Seek medical help if the burn is larger than 3 inches or on the face, hands, or feet.
child_instructions: Cool the burn with running water for 10 minutes. Cover with cling film or a clean, non-stick dressing. Do not apply creams, ice, or butter. Seek medical help immediately for any burn larger than the child’s palm or on sensitive areas.

label: choking
adult_instructions: Encourage coughing. If ineffective, give 5 back blows between shoulder blades. Perform 5 abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver). Call emergency services if choking persists.
child_instructions: Encourage coughing. For infants (<1 year): 5 back blows and 5 chest thrusts. For children (>1 year): 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts with caution. Call emergency services immediately.

label: bleeding
adult_instructions: Apply firm, direct pressure with a clean cloth or bandage. Elevate the wound if possible. Bandage firmly but not too tightly. Seek medical help if bleeding doesn’t stop after 10 minutes.
child_instructions: Apply firm, direct pressure with a clean cloth. Elevate the wound if possible. Bandage gently. Seek medical help immediately if bleeding is heavy or persists.

label: fracture
adult_instructions: Immobilize the limb with a splint or padding (e.g., rolled towel). Avoid moving the injured area. Apply ice wrapped in cloth for 15 minutes. Call emergency help or visit a hospital.
child_instructions: Immobilize the limb gently with padding. Do not attempt to realign. Apply ice wrapped in cloth for 10 minutes. Seek emergency care immediately.

label: fainting
adult_instructions: Lay the person flat on their back. Elevate legs 12 inches unless head injury suspected. Ensure fresh air and loosen tight clothing. Monitor breathing. Seek medical help if not recovering in 1–2 minutes.
child_instructions: Lay the child flat on a safe surface. Elevate legs gently if no head injury. Ensure fresh air. Monitor breathing closely. Seek medical help if recovery takes over 1 minute.

label: asthma
adult_instructions: Help use a rescue inhaler (e.g., albuterol) as prescribed. Sit upright, stay calm, and breathe slowly. Call emergency services if symptoms worsen or no improvement after 5 minutes.
child_instructions: Help use a rescue inhaler as prescribed. Sit the child upright and calm them. Call emergency services immediately if breathing difficulties persist or lips turn blue.

label: heart_attack
adult_instructions: Call emergency services immediately. Keep person calm and seated or lying down. Give 325mg aspirin (chewable) if available and not allergic. Monitor breathing.
child_instructions: Call emergency services immediately. Keep child calm and in a comfortable position. Do not give aspirin. Monitor breathing and seek urgent care.

label: stroke
adult_instructions: Call emergency help immediately. Note the time symptoms started. Keep person safe and calm. Do not give food or drink. Monitor for worsening symptoms.
child_instructions: Call emergency help immediately. Note symptom onset time. Keep child safe and calm. Do not give food or drink. Seek urgent care.

label: allergy
adult_instructions: Use epinephrine (EpiPen) if prescribed for severe symptoms. Call emergency services. Lay person flat unless breathing is difficult. Monitor for swelling or breathing issues.
child_instructions: Use epinephrine (EpiPen) if prescribed. Call emergency services immediately. Lay child flat unless breathing is difficult. Monitor closely.

label: seizure
adult_instructions: Clear surroundings of hazards. Cushion the head with soft material. Time the seizure. Do not restrain or put anything in mouth. Call emergency services if seizure lasts over 5 minutes.
child_instructions: Clear surroundings. Cushion the head gently. Time the seizure. Do not restrain. Call emergency services if seizure lasts over 3 minutes or is the first seizure.

label: nosebleed
adult_instructions: Sit forward and pinch the soft part of the nose for 10 minutes. Avoid tilting head back. Apply a cold compress to the nose bridge. Seek medical help if bleeding persists over 20 minutes.
child_instructions: Sit forward and pinch the nose gently for 5–10 minutes. Apply a cold compress. Seek medical help if bleeding continues over 15 minutes or is frequent.

label: poisoning
adult_instructions: Call poison control immediately (e.g., 1-800-222-1222 in the US). Do not induce vomiting unless instructed. Identify the substance and amount ingested. Seek emergency care.
child_instructions: Call poison control immediately. Do not induce vomiting. Identify the substance and amount. Take child to emergency care immediately.

label: drowning
adult_instructions: Remove from water safely. Check breathing and pulse. Begin CPR if needed (30 chest compressions, 2 breaths). Call emergency services. Continue until help arrives.
child_instructions: Remove from water safely. Check breathing. Begin CPR for children (30 compressions, 2 breaths, adjusted for size). Call emergency services immediately.

label: electric_shock
adult_instructions: Turn off power source before touching victim. Check breathing and pulse. Begin CPR if needed. Call emergency services. Treat burns if present.
child_instructions: Turn off power source before touching child. Check breathing. Begin CPR if needed. Call emergency services immediately. Treat burns as needed.

label: hypothermia
adult_instructions: Move to a warm, dry area. Remove wet clothing and wrap in blankets. Offer warm drinks if conscious. Call medical help if shivering stops or confusion occurs.
child_instructions: Move to a warm area. Remove wet clothing and wrap in blankets. Offer warm (not hot) fluids if conscious. Seek medical help immediately if unresponsive or confused.

label: heatstroke
adult_instructions: Move to shade or cool area. Cool with water or wet cloths. Fan the person. Offer cool fluids if conscious. Call emergency services if temperature exceeds 104°F.
child_instructions: Move to shade. Cool with lukewarm water or cloths. Offer small sips of water if conscious. Call emergency services immediately for high fever or confusion.

label: snake_bite
adult_instructions: Keep person calm and still. Immobilize the bitten area below heart level. Do not apply ice, tourniquets, or suck venom. Call emergency services immediately.
child_instructions: Keep child calm and still. Immobilize the bitten area gently. Do not apply ice or tourniquets. Call emergency services immediately.

label: dog_bite
adult_instructions: Wash wound with soap and water for 5 minutes. Apply a clean bandage. Seek medical advice for antibiotics or tetanus shot, especially if deep or infected.
child_instructions: Wash wound gently with soap and water. Apply a clean bandage. Seek medical advice immediately for antibiotics or tetanus shot.

label: insect_sting
adult_instructions: Remove stinger by scraping with a card. Wash with soap and water. Apply ice for 10 minutes. Take antihistamine (e.g., loratadine 10mg daily) for itching. Seek help if swelling spreads.
child_instructions: Remove stinger gently. Wash with soap and water. Apply ice for 5–10 minutes. Consult a pediatrician for antihistamines. Seek help for swelling or breathing issues.

label: sprain
adult_instructions: Use RICE: Rest, Ice (15 minutes every hour), Compress with a bandage, Elevate. Take ibuprofen 200–400mg every 6 hours as needed for pain. Consult a doctor if swelling persists.
child_instructions: Use RICE: Rest, Ice (10 minutes), Compress gently, Elevate. Do not give ibuprofen without doctor’s advice. Consult a pediatrician if unable to bear weight.

label: eye_injury
adult_instructions: Do not rub eye. Flush with clean water or saline for 15 minutes. Cover with a clean cloth. Seek medical help immediately for pain or vision changes.
child_instructions: Do not rub eye. Flush gently with saline or water for 10 minutes. Cover with a clean cloth. Seek medical help immediately.

label: head_injury
adult_instructions: Keep person awake and resting. Apply ice wrapped in cloth for 15 minutes. Monitor for vomiting, confusion, or drowsiness. Seek urgent care if symptoms worsen.
child_instructions: Keep child awake and calm. Apply ice wrapped in cloth for 10 minutes. Monitor for vomiting or behavior changes. Seek urgent care immediately.

label: cut
adult_instructions: Wash with soap and water for 5 minutes. Apply antiseptic (e.g., povidone-iodine). Bandage with a sterile dressing. Seek medical help if deep or gaping.
child_instructions: Wash gently with soap and water. Apply antiseptic. Bandage with a sterile dressing. Seek medical help for deep cuts or if bleeding persists.

label: panic_attack
adult_instructions: Encourage slow, deep breathing (inhale 4 seconds, exhale 4 seconds). Stay calm and reassure. Move to a quiet area. Seek help if symptoms persist over 30 minutes.
child_instructions: Encourage slow breathing with a calm voice. Stay with child and reassure. Seek medical help if panic does not subside or worsens.

label: tooth_out
adult_instructions: Rinse tooth gently with water (do not scrub). Try reinserting in socket or store in milk. Visit a dentist within 1 hour.
child_instructions: Rinse tooth gently with water. Do not reinsert. Store in milk or saline. Visit a dentist immediately.

label: concussion
adult_instructions: Rest in a quiet, dark room. Avoid screens and physical activity. Monitor for confusion, vomiting, or worsening headache. Seek medical attention if symptoms persist.
child_instructions: Rest in a quiet room. Avoid screens and activity. Monitor for vomiting, confusion, or irritability. Seek medical attention immediately.

label: dehydration
adult_instructions: Give small sips of water or oral rehydration salts (e.g., Pedialyte) every 5 minutes. Avoid sugary drinks. Seek medical help if unable to keep fluids down or lethargic.
child_instructions: Give small sips of oral rehydration salts (e.g., Pedialyte) every 5 minutes. Avoid juices. Seek medical help immediately if lethargic or no urine output.

label: frostbite
adult_instructions: Move to a warm area. Soak affected area in warm (not hot) water for 15–30 minutes. Do not rub or use direct heat. Seek medical help for severe pain or blisters.
child_instructions: Move to a warm area. Soak gently in warm water for 10–20 minutes. Do not rub. Seek medical help immediately for blisters or numbness.

label: allergic_conjunctivitis
adult_instructions: Rinse eyes with saline. Apply cold compress for 10 minutes. Take antihistamine (e.g., loratadine 10mg daily). Consult a doctor if symptoms persist.
child_instructions: Rinse eyes with saline. Apply cold compress gently. Consult a pediatrician for antihistamines. Seek help if vision is affected.

label: dislocation
adult_instructions: Do not attempt to reposition. Immobilize with a sling or padding. Apply ice for 15 minutes. Seek emergency care immediately.
child_instructions: Do not attempt to reposition. Immobilize gently. Apply ice for 10 minutes. Seek emergency care immediately.

label: chemical_burn
adult_instructions: Rinse with running water for at least 15 minutes. Remove contaminated clothing. Call emergency services. Do not apply neutralizers unless instructed.
child_instructions: Rinse with running water for 15 minutes. Remove contaminated clothing carefully. Call emergency services immediately.

label: heat_exhaustion
adult_instructions: Move to a cool area. Sip water or electrolyte drink (e.g., Gatorade) every 5 minutes. Apply cool, wet cloths. Seek medical help if nausea or confusion occurs.
child_instructions: Move to a cool area. Offer small sips of water or electrolyte drink. Apply cool cloths. Seek medical help immediately for confusion or vomiting.

label: anaphylaxis
adult_instructions: Administer epinephrine (EpiPen) immediately if prescribed. Call emergency services. Keep person lying down unless breathing is difficult. Monitor closely.
child_instructions: Administer epinephrine (EpiPen) immediately if prescribed. Call emergency services. Keep child lying down unless breathing is difficult. Monitor closely.

label: stomach_pain
adult_instructions: Rest, avoid solid foods, drink clear fluids. Take antacids (e.g., Tums) 500mg as needed, up to 4 times daily (morning, noon, evening, bedtime). Seek medical help if pain is severe, persistent, or with fever.
child_instructions: Rest, drink clear fluids. Do not give medication without doctor’s advice. Consult a pediatrician immediately for severe pain or fever.

label: fever
adult_instructions: Rest, stay hydrated. Take paracetamol 500mg every 4–6 hours (morning, noon, evening), up to 4 doses daily (max 3000mg/day). Seek medical help if fever exceeds 103°F or lasts over 48 hours.
child_instructions: Consult a pediatrician for appropriate medication and dosage based on weight and age. Keep hydrated, use cool compresses. Seek help if fever exceeds 102°F or persists.

label: cough
adult_instructions: Stay hydrated, rest. Take dextromethorphan 10–20mg every 4 hours (morning, noon, evening) as needed, per package instructions. Seek medical help if cough persists over a week or with fever.
child_instructions: Consult a pediatrician before giving medication. Offer warm fluids, use a humidifier. Seek help if cough is severe, persistent, or with fever.

label: common_cold
adult_instructions: Rest, drink fluids. Take antihistamines (e.g., loratadine 10mg daily, morning) or decongestants per package instructions. Seek medical help if symptoms worsen or fever develops.
child_instructions: Consult a pediatrician for medication. Ensure rest, hydration, use saline nasal drops. Seek help if high fever or breathing difficulties occur.

label: diabetic_emergency
adult_instructions: For low blood sugar (hypoglycemia): Give 15g fast-acting sugar (e.g., glucose tablets, 4 oz juice). Recheck in 15 minutes. For high blood sugar (hyperglycemia): Drink water, seek medical help if vomiting or confused.
child_instructions: For low blood sugar: Give 10–15g fast-acting sugar (e.g., juice). Recheck in 15 minutes. For high blood sugar: Consult a pediatrician immediately. Seek emergency care for confusion.

label: chest_pain
adult_instructions: Rest and sit upright. Take ibuprofen 200–400mg every 6 hours as needed for musculoskeletal pain. Call emergency services if pain is severe, radiates, or with shortness of breath.
child_instructions: Rest and keep child calm. Do not give medication without doctor’s advice. Seek emergency care immediately for severe pain or breathing issues.

label: severe_allergic_rash
adult_instructions: Wash skin with soap and water. Take antihistamine (e.g., loratadine 10mg daily). Apply hydrocortisone 1% cream twice daily. Seek medical help if rash spreads or breathing issues occur.
child_instructions: Wash skin gently. Consult a pediatrician for antihistamines or creams. Seek medical help immediately if rash worsens or breathing is affected.

label: foreign_object_ear_nose
scenario: Foreign Object in Ear or Nose
adult_instructions: Do not attempt to remove. Keep person calm. Seek medical help immediately to avoid pushing object deeper.
child_instructions: Do not attempt to remove. Keep child calm and prevent touching. Seek medical help immediately.

label: mild_traumatic_brain_injury
adult_instructions: Rest in a quiet, dark room. Take paracetamol 500mg every 4–6 hours as needed for headache (max 3000mg/day). Monitor for worsening symptoms. Seek medical help if confusion or vomiting occurs.
child_instructions: Rest in a quiet room. Consult a pediatrician for pain relief. Monitor for vomiting, confusion, or irritability. Seek medical help immediately.

label: severe_diarrhea
adult_instructions: Drink oral rehydration salts (e.g., Pedialyte) every 5–10 minutes. Avoid solid foods for 12 hours. Take loperamide 2mg after each loose stool (max 16mg/day) if no fever. Seek medical help if blood in stool or dehydration.
child_instructions: Give oral rehydration salts in small sips every 5 minutes. Avoid solid foods. Consult a pediatrician before giving medication. Seek medical help for blood in stool or lethargy.

label: sunburn
adult_instructions: Cool skin with cold water for 10 minutes. Apply aloe vera gel or hydrocortisone 1% cream twice daily. Take ibuprofen 200–400mg every 6 hours for pain. Seek medical help for blisters or fever.
child_instructions: Cool skin with lukewarm water for 5–10 minutes. Apply aloe vera gel. Consult a pediatrician for creams or pain relief. Seek medical help for blisters or high fever.

label: facial_swelling
adult_instructions: Apply cold compress for 10 minutes. Take antihistamine (e.g., loratadine 10mg daily) for possible allergic reaction. Seek emergency care if swelling affects breathing or throat.
child_instructions: Apply cold compress gently. Consult a pediatrician for antihistamines. Seek emergency care immediately if swelling affects breathing or throat.

label: joint_pain
adult_instructions: Rest the joint. Apply ice for 15 minutes every hour. Take ibuprofen 200–400mg every 6 hours as needed (max 3200mg/day). Seek medical help if swelling or inability to move persists.
child_instructions: Rest the joint. Apply ice for 10 minutes. Consult a pediatrician for pain relief. Seek medical help if swelling or movement is restricted.

label: earache
adult_instructions: Apply warm compress for 10 minutes. Take paracetamol 500mg every 4–6 hours as needed (max 3000mg/day). Seek medical help if pain persists over 24 hours or with fever.
child_instructions: Apply warm compress gently. Consult a pediatrician for pain relief or drops. Seek medical help immediately if fever or discharge occurs.
